meanings.definition: (verb) To check an opponent in the opponent's defensive zone.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the player will forecheck to prevent the opponent from advancing.
meanings.sent2: The team's strategy includes forechecking to put pressure on the other team.
meanings.sent3: The coach joked that the best way to stop the other team is to forecheck them all the way back to their bench.
meanings.sent4: Forechecking is like a silent guardian, always ready to defend the defensive zone.
meanings.sent5: Forechecking is a crucial skill that can turn the tide of a game.

meanings.definition: (noun) The act of checking an opponent in the opponent's defensive zone.
meanings.sent1: A strong forecheck can disrupt the opponent's plays effectively.
meanings.sent2: The team's success was attributed to their aggressive forecheck throughout the game.
meanings.sent3: The forecheck by the player was so intense that it almost looked like a dance.
meanings.sent4: In hockey, the forecheck is like a shield protecting the defensive zone.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered loudly at the team's flawless forecheck.
